intro: Spermacoce riparia, commonly known as water cheeseweed, is a herbaceous annual plant native to wetlands and disturbed areas in the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are often hairy, and it produces small, white or pale blue flowers clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a schizocarp, splitting into two one-seeded parts when mature. Spermacoce riparia is adapted to moist environments and is often found near streams, ponds, and other water bodies.
